title: Systems Engineer - Aircraft Level
content:
A career at Lilium is for those who want to do something extraordinary. We take pride in pushing the boundaries of engineering, technology and customer experience.  
As part of a team, you will tackle challenges and deliver something that has never been done before.â€¯By joining Lilium you will have the opportunity to work with a world-class entrepreneurial team of more thanâ€¯ 800 people who are â€¯as passionate about changing the world as you are.  
You will always act with safety and integrity in mind and embody our core behaviors of efficient and positive collaboration, ownership of time, continuous improvements and, ultimately delivering results.
We thrive on diversity and creating an inclusive culture, with more than 50 nationalities currently working hard to bring our vision of a sustainable world to life. Your Role and your Team:
Systems Engineers are internationally recognised as the innovators and architects of complex products and solutions. This role gives the successful applicant the opportunity to become a significant part of our Systems Engineering team on our leading project.
Working within a complex stakeholder landscape and often with immature, developing and changing requirements, you will be expected to assist and guide our internal departments to scope, develop and deliver solutions. This is a prominent position within our organisation, which puts people at the heart of its success, with great follow-on prospects.
Interested candidates should possess an engineering or physical science degree, or a substantial period in industry. It goes without saying you will have a passion for the discipline of Systems Engineering and a desire to share your passion with the team.
You will become a leading engineer on a large scale and complex project. In this role you will ensure the product meets the business, operational, and legal requirements as part of an integrated project team.
The successful applicant will be a decision maker and become a key part of the Systems Engineering team. You will be empowered within the project to make decisions on technical aspects, and will lead systems, requirements, and functions work through our governance process.
Your Tasks:
Promote the implementation of Systems Engineering across the Engineering teams.
Be an integral part of the team, projecting positive behaviours and influence onto the team.
Possess an in-depth knowledge of the standards and specifications appropriate to the discipline of Systems Engineering (i.e., INCOSE knowledge, ARP4754A experience, etc).
Apply a pragmatic and best practice Systems Engineering techniques to support our projects and business development activities.
Application of the Engineering procedures in the conduct of your work.
Work effectively across the matrix and deliver bottom-line performance collaboratively.
Challenge the status quo, bring new ideas to improve engineering quality, productivity, and timeliness of delivery.
Enforce standards, ensure rigour, resilience, and continuous improvement in design solutions, meeting all regulatory requirements, conforming to specifications, quality and requirements within schedule and budget.
Act as a project integrator and interface between project management and other engineering teams.
Lead engagement with the stakeholder to develop a shared understanding of project objectives / milestones and develop a working relationship.
Your Profile:
You will be a qualified Systems Engineer with hands-on experience in the aerospace sector. Experience outside of aerospace in other relevant sectors will be an advantage. We are seeking people with the ability to make a difference and pro-actively lead our Systems Engineering approach to large and complex project work.
We are looking to recruit in the width of Systems Engineering, which will cover a range of experience so if you have the passion and a desire to make a difference but are relatively junior in your present role then donâ€™t be put off â€“ we would love to hear from you. You will have the following skills and qualities:
Good interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate with energy and enthusiasm to all levels within and without the business.
The ability to apply your skills and knowledge across a wide and diverse range of projects.
Ideally qualified to degree level in a STEM subject with relevant and sufficient experience in the field.
Market awareness with a good understanding of the market in which Lilium operates, including competitors, suppliers, and regulatory organisations.
Experienced in planning and delivering large and complex tasks to schedule and budget demonstrating effective time management across many projects and priorities.
Proven experience of supporting team members to deliver and develop through coaching and guidance.
Sound understanding of product safety, standards, technical risk management.
Experienced with generating and managing requirements.
Broad technical understanding of engineering fields
Experience in fields such as human-system integration, equipment environmental qualification, aircraft performance and aircraft level systems engineering management is a plus.
Experience in several phases of the aircraft development life cycle is a plus.
Familiarity with ALM and PLM tools (e.g., Teamcenter, Polarion) is a plus.
#LI-K1Want to know more? Then view our 'Why join Lilium' page!
Life at Lilium:
The wellbeing of our employees is a high priority. In our HQ we have many initiatives such as free healthy food and drinks, free in-house gym and health days. In remote offices we offer online opportunities to stay connected and develop yourself as well including our culture club, learning terminal, Employee Assistance Program and many more.
 Lilium is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all qualified individuals regardless of ethnicity, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age.
